items.title: Mega Millions lottery ticket buyers test luck for $1.15 billion jackpot
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
Americans still dreaming of a really big Christmas present can keep that dream alive during Friday’s Mega Millions drawing for a jackpot worth an estimated $1.15 billion. 

(AP Video by Terry Chea)

items.title: Children become victims of unprecedented violence in Chile
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
The killing of a 10-year-old girl in Chile shocked the South American country in January 2024. Agustina Pascale became one of the first public faces of an unprecedented wave of killings that is on track to leave a record number of minors as victims of criminal gangs this year—whether recruited or killed in the crossfire. By mid-November, a total of 48 children had been killed by firearms, six more than were recorded in all of 2023, officials said.  

(AP Video by Mauricio Cuevas)

Subscribe: http://smarturl.it/AssociatedPress
Read more: https://apnews.com​

This video may be available for archive licensing via https://newsroom.ap.org/home

items.title: LIVE: Vigil in Thailand on 20th anniversary of 2004 Indian Ocean tsunami
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
A vigil is held in Thailand as people mark 20 years since the massive 2004 Indian Ocean tsunami that killed some 230,000 people across a dozen countries, making it one of modern history’s worst natural disasters. Read more here: https://bit.ly/4gtQtw1

#thailand #tsunami #live

items.title: Attorney general orders probe into report alleging Netanyahu's wife harassed opponents
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
Israel’s attorney general has ordered police to open an investigation into Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s wife on suspicion of harassing political opponents and witnesses in the Israeli leader’s corruption trial.

items.title: How to protect your pets from bird flu
items.author: Associated Press
items.content: The death of an Oregon house cat and a pet food recall are raising questions about the ongoing outbreak of bird flu. The AP explains how you can protect your furry friends from the disease. #shorts #birdflu #avianinfluenza #H5N1 #cats #dogs #pets

items.title: Russian anti-aircraft weapon likely caused Azerbaijan plane crash, experts say
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
Aviation experts say that Russian air defense fire was likely responsible for the Azerbaijani plane crash that killed 38 people and left all 29 survivors injured.

items.title: Deaths reported as Israel launches airstrikes on airport in rebel-held capital of Yemen
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
Several people were killed on Thursday and dozens wounded in Israeli airstrikes on the main civilian airport in the Houthi rebel-held capital of Yemen. According to the United Nations, three people were killed in the strikes on Sanaa airport, while media controlled by the Houthis reported multiple deaths.

Subscribe: http://smarturl.it/AssociatedPress
Read more: https://apnews.com​

This video may be available for archive licensing via https://newsroom.ap.org/home

items.title: People injured in Azerbaijan Airlines plane crash in Kazakhstan medevaced to Baku
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
A plane carrying seven people injured in the Azerbaijan Airlines' Embraer 190 crash arrived at Heydar Aliyev International Airport in Baku on Thursday evening. The plane was en route from Azerbaijan's capital of Baku to the Russian city of Grozny in the North Caucasus on Wednesday when it was diverted and crashed while making an attempt to land in Aktau, Kazakhstan after flying east across the Caspian Sea. The crash killed 38 people and left all 29 survivors injured. 

Subscribe: http://smarturl.it/AssociatedPress
Read more: https://apnews.com​

items.title: ‘Squid Game’ director enjoys when characters die off
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
"I was smiling inside."

"Squid Game 2" creator, writer and director Hwang Dong-hyuk shares his unexpected on-set response to characters' deaths.

items.title: LIVE: Pope Francis visits prison in Rome to open Holy Door and hold a Mass
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
Pope Francis visits Rebibbia Prison in Rome, where he will symbolically open a Holy Door with inmates and preside over a Mass. Francis has dedicated the 2025 Jubilee, the once-every-25-year tradition, to the theme of hope. 

#popefrancis #rome #live

items.title: Sinkhole prompts lane closures on Interstate 80 in New Jersey
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
A sinkhole that opened up Thursday along Interstate 80 in northern New Jersey forced authorities to close the heavily traveled highway's eastbound lanes. The sinkhole was discovered near Wharton, which is about 40 miles west of New York City.

items.title: Tika Sumpter co-wrote a new film being directed by Tyler Perry
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
Tika Sumpter "took the lead" on the upcoming Tyler Perry film that she stars in and co-wrote. Her latest film is "Sonic the Hedgehog 3."
#tikasumpter #tylerperry #shorts

items.title: Endangered pygmy hippo born at Virginia zoo
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
An endangered pygmy hippo has been born at a Virginia zoo. The yet-unnamed female was born Dec. 9 at Metro Richmond Zoo in Moseley, Virginia.  This is the parent's second calf to arrive right before the holidays. 

Subscribe: http://smarturl.it/AssociatedPress
